CF1V3-20160304-00001292,Contract,Merseytravel,Awarded,2016-03-10T12:06:13Z,"Provision of Cash in Transit Security Services Across the Merseytravel Estate","A suitable supplier is sought to provide Cash in Transit security services across the Merseytravel estate; Including Merseytravel Locations across Merseyside including the Beatles Story attraction, Mersey Ferries and Mersey Tunnels.
The scope of the works is to cover:

column2: The collection of sealed bags from Merseytravel  Centres located in Huyton, St Helens, Bootle, Birkenhead and 2 sites in Liverpool City Centre.
The collection of  sealed bags  from 2  Beatles Story locations within Liverpool City Centre on a weekly cycle with revised high and low season arrangements being in place.
The collection of sealed containers from Merseytravel Head Quarters, Liverpool City Centre on a weekly cycle.

The collection of sealed containers from  4 Mersey Ferries locations: Pier Head, Woodside, Seacombe and the Spaceport visitor attraction Seacombe on a weekly cycle with revised high and low season arrangements being in place.

The collection of sealed containers and Bulk Coin for  from Mersey Tunnels Kingsway (Wallasey) and Queensway (Birkenhead) locations 6 days per week (including Bank Holidays)  Merseytravel are looking for a specialist provider to offer an effective solution for the collection of bulk coin on a daily basis for prompt payment into the relevant Bank Account.
The monthly collection of Euro (notes) in a sealed container from Kingsway (Wallasey) Tunnel deposit direct to the local Liverpool City banking branch, or other suitable arrangements.
To remove and empty the cash vault within the self ? contained  Automatic Toilets located at St Helen?s Travel Centre  monthly and bank the revenue until January 2017.
To provide cash (ad hoc change orders) as and when required, the denominations and amount being notified in advance on the previous morning by the individual location on an ad hoc basis.
Collections are Monday to Saturday and this should also include Bank Holidays for some locations.
Collection times should to be varied within the given timeframes in accordance with Insurance Assessors advice.

Flexibility of service provision is required in terms of collection windows, frequency of collections, locations of Travel Centres,  business changes, the introduction of card payments at Mersey Tunnels, Special Events and Bank Holiday collection arrangements.

column1: The contract will be for an initial 2 year period with the opportunity of a further 2 year extension to commence April 2016.

PP15103,Contract,"WOLVERHAMPTON CITY COUNCIL",Awarded,2016-03-17T10:01:06Z,"Cash in Transit","Annually the cash in transit contract is responsible for over 18,000 secure collections and efficient deposits of income to the council’s bank.
Sealed bag collections are made from 127 establishments across the city including but not restricted to; Schools, WV Active, Wolverhampton Homes, Markets, Galleries and the Civic Centre.
The contract is sub divided into schedules for 39 and 52 week collections for establishments across the city with an additional provision for adhoc usage which is subject to fluctuation.
The service provision required by the Council consists of:
· Regular collection of monies from establishments across the City
· Ad Hoc collections of monies from establishments across the City
· Regular collections of monies from the car parks across the City Centre
· Regular collection of monies from the pay & display machines across the City Centre
· Cash processing of monies collected from car parks across the City Centre

· Delivery of coinage through a bulk cash facility to establishments across the City",,,"West Midlands","66100000 ","Jessica Prince",tenders@wolverhampton.gov.uk,"Civic Centre","St. Peter's Square",Wolverhampton,"WV1 1RL",England,,,"PP15103 Cash in Transit Specification 080316.pdf PP15103 Appendix 1 CIT Address Details 190216.xlsx ","www.wolverhamptontenders.com ",,01/08/2016,31/07/2020,19/04/2016,NO,,No,No,No,Services,740000,,21/07/2016,748896.48,"[Security Plus + Limited|The Manor House

FEE/0229 3,Contract,"DEPARTMENT FOR ENVIRONMENT, FOOD & RURAL AFFAIRS",Awarded,2015-07-22T15:13:54Z,"Cash-in-Transit and Related Services","Tenders are invited for the provision of cash-in-transit, cash processing and change float services.  The services are required at Forestry Commission premises and car park machines are various sites across England.  Due to the wide geographical coverage required, this tender has been split into 11 lots.  Bidders should note that within each lot there may be remote locations and should satisfy themselves that they are able to service all locations prior to submitting a tender for that lot.  The successful contractor(s) must be able to provide services 7 days a week including weekends and Bank Holidays.

Please express your interest in this tender to procurement.england@forestry.gsi.gov.uk by 11th May 2015 to allow us to notify you of any questions and answers we may receive.",,,"North East,North West,Yorkshire and the Humber,East Midlands,West Midlands,East of England,London,South East,South West","79710000 66112000 ","Procurement England",procurement.england@forestry.gov.uk,"620 Bristol Business Park","Coldharbour Lane",Bristol,"BS16 1EJ",England,,,"CIT FINAL ITT.doc Appendix 3 - Pricing Schedule - Version 2.xls Appendix 2 - Ticket Returns.xls Appendix 1 - Site Info.xls ",,"Suppliers must express their interest in this tender by the 11th May 2015.  To express an interest please email: procurement.england@forestry.gsi.gov.uk. Suppliers must download the attached tender documents by the same date. A2014160,Contract,Centro,Awarded,2015-04-22T15:56:29Z,"Tender Opportunity for Cash Collection Services","Suppliers are invited to submit a tender response for Cash Collection Services.

Centro (West Midlands Passenger Transport Executive) requires a cash collection/management service for a number of its sites, namely New Street Station Travel Information Centre, Wolverhampton Travel Information Centre, Centro House and Stourbridge Interchange. Please note that other sites and collection services may be required over the period of the contract.
As part of the tender process, suppliers will be required to complete qualification, technical and commercial envelopes.
The qualification envelope contains minimum requirements that must be met in order for the tender response to be considered. Tenders will be evaluated on the basis of 10% Quality and 90% Price.
The submission deadline is 17:00pm on 8th May 2015 and a single supplier will be appointed.
The contract commencement date will be 1st June 2015 and the contract shall be for a period of 3 years with the option for Centro to extend for a further 12 months to 31st May 2019

Suppliers wishing to participate should register as a supplier within the Bravo Solution Portal and then express and interest to project_81 - Cash Collection Services. For more details please visit https://centro.bravosolution.co.uk

All requests for clarification or further information must be submitted via the message facility of the Bravo Solution Portal",,,"West Midlands","66112000 ",,procurementteam@centro.org.uk,"Centro, Centro House, 16 Summer Lane",,Birmingham,"B19 3SD",England,,http://www.centro.org.uk/about-us/procurement/,,"https://centro.bravosolution.co.uk ","Suppliers wishing to participate should register as a supplier within the Bravo Solution Portal and then express and interest to

project_81 - Cash Collection Services. For more details please visit https://centro.bravosolution.co.uk ",01/06/2015,31/05/2018,08/05/2015,NO,,Yes,No,No,Services,47000,,28/05/2015,47000,"[Security Plus + Limited|The Manor House

324F_15,Contract,Espo,Awarded,2015-10-29T11:23:00Z,"324F_15 Cash Collection and Cash and Valuables in Transit (CVIT) Services","The collaborative (ESPO and YPO) framework intends to provide a national solution for Cash Collection andCash and Valuables in Transit (CVIT) Services. This will include the secure collection, processing, consolidationand onward depositing of money to high street banks, nominated cash receiving facilities, and other suitablereceiving locations.
The framework will be awarded by Lot on a regional basis. The tender will be broken down into 12 Lots:
— Lot — Cash Collection and Cash In Transit from Premises or Buildings of various types and On Street andOff Street Car Parks (Including Pay and Display Machines).
The above mentioned Lot will be split on a regional basis:
An e-Auction process may be used to award subsequent call off contracts following the reopening of competitionamong the parties to the Framework Agreement.
The framework agreement has the option to extend for up to a further 12 months.The total estimated values stated include the option period.

As a Central Purchasing Bodies as defined by the EU Procurement Directive 2014/24/EU, the FrameworkAgreement is open for use by the following classifications of user throughout all administrative regions of theUK:
— Central Government Departments and Agencies and Local Government Departments and Agencies;
— Police, Fire and Rescue and Coastguard Emergency Services;
— NHS and HSC Bodies, including Ambulance Services;
— Any Public Body established by or under the Scotland Act 1998 or any Act of the Scottish Parliament.

Full details of the classification of end user establishments and geographical areas is available on: http://www.espo.org/About-us-%281%29/FAQs/Legal",,,"Any region","79710000 60000000 ","ESPO, for itself and on behalf of YPO",tenders@espo.org,"Barnsdale Way, Grove Park",Enderby,Leicester,"LE19 3EJ",England,,,,,,09/02/2016,31/12/2018,04/12/2015,NO,,Yes,Yes,No,Services,10000000,30000000,09/02/2016,10000000,"[BDI Securities Limited|Unit F8 Harbet Road

WDCCASH2018,Contract,"Wychavon District Council",Awarded,2018-04-04T15:36:42Z,"FRAMEWORK AGREEMENT FOR THE PROVISION OF CASH IN TRANSIT SERVICES","The Wychavon District Council along with a number of other Public Authorities wish to create a supplier framework for the Provision of Cash in Transit Services. That is the collection and delivery of cash, to and from Corporate Sites and Car Parks from which the Lead Authority and other Public Authorities (together the ""Contracting Authorities"" and each a ""Contracting Authority"") may procure services on a call-off basis. Named Contracting authorities entitled to use this arrangement are: Bromsgrove District, Malvern Hills District, Redditch Borough, Worcester City, Wychavon District and Wyre Forest District Councils. The Tender consists of 2 Lots:
Lot 1 - Supply of cash in transit services to and from corporate sites
Lot 2- Supply of cash in transit services to and from car parks, including pay and display machines

Whilst we have divided the requirement into Lots, this does not preclude Tenderers from bidding for both lots, if they feel that they can adequately deliver the various services required.",,,"West Midlands","79000000 ",,procurement@wychavon.gov.uk,"Civic Centre","Queen Elizabeth Drive",Pershore,"WR10 1PT",England,,,"WDC Cash Collections Framework ITT 2018.zip ",,"The Council is using the e-procurement portal known as the Due North Pro-Contract portal https://procontract.due-north.com to conduct this procurement exercise. To gain access to the Invitation to Tender documents (ITT) tenderers will need to register their company details here https://procontract.due-north.com/SupplierRegistration/Register. Once registered, tenderers will be emailed a log-in and password which will allow them to gain access to the tender documents. Tenderers will need to electronically submit an expression of interest and then follow the instructions on screen to get copies of the procurement documents. Tenderers must submit their completed ITT documents and accompanying documentation via the Pro-Contract on-line portal. Any questions from tenderers will also need to be submitted via the Pro-Contract portal website. Clarifications and further tender documents will be issued via the Pro-Contract portal. If you have any problems or queries gaining access to the Pro-Contract portal please contact the online ProContract Service help desk.",05/02/2018,04/12/2022,08/01/2018,YES,WDCCASH2018,Yes,Yes,No,Services,0,,19/01/2018,488866,"[JADE SECURITY SERVICES LIMITED|Grovelands Avenue
GB|COMPANIES_HOUSE|03549438|Yes|No][SECURITY PLUS LIMITED|Bellringer Road, Trentham Lakes South
